dlentry.dd: This method is deprecated as of v2.4.0. See the following methods instead:

section.p:
This method shares the whole screen, specified window, or specified region:
Whole screen: Set @p windowId as 0 and @p rect as NULL.
Specified window: Set @p windowId as a value other than 0. Each window has a @p windowId that is not 0.
Specified region: Set @p windowId as 0 and @p rect not as NULL. In this case, you can share the specified region, for example by dragging the mouse or implementing your own logic. The specified region is a region on the whole screen. Currently, sharing a specified region in a specific window is not supported.
section.note: captureFreq is the captured frame rate once the screen-sharing function is enabled. The mandatory value ranges between 1 fps and 15 fps. No matter which of the above functions you enable, 0 will be returned when the execution is successful, and an error code will be returned when the execution fails.

plentry.pd: @param captureFreq (Mandatory) The captured frame rate. The value ranges between 1 fps and 15 fps.
@param rect Specifies the screen-sharing region. @p rect is valid when @p windowsId is set as 0. When @p rect is set as NULL, the whole screen is shared.
